qas.question: How many roadways will be included in the district?
What place is home to the Atlantic City Aquarium?
What place was originally left off of the tourism district?
Where was the residential neighborhood that was removed from the final boundaries of the district?
Who cast the lone "no" vote on the creation of the district citing Bader Field's inclusion?

context: The tourism district would comprise several key areas in the city; the Marina District, Ducktown, Chelsea, South Inlet, Bader Field, and Gardner's Basin. Also included are <a0_0>10<a0_0/> roadways that lead into the district, including several in the city's northern end, or North Beach. <a1_0><a2_0>Gardner's Basin<a2_0/><a1_0/>, which is home to the Atlantic City Aquarium, was initially left out of the tourism district, while a residential neighborhood in the <a3_0>Chelsea<a3_0/> section was removed from the final boundaries, owing to complaints from the city. Also, the inclusion of Bader Field in the district was controversial and received much scrutiny from <a4_0>mayor Lorenzo Langford<a4_0/>, who cast the lone "no" vote on the creation of the district citing its inclusion.
